course_name: MILITARY SCIENCE I: INTRODUCTION TO ARMY LEADERSHIP AND ROTC
description: Introduction to ROTC, and its relationship to the U.S. Army. Role of the army officer, including leadership and management fundamentals. Introduction to land navigation. Lec/lab.

course_name: MILITARY SCIENCE I: INTRODUCTION TO BASIC MILITARY SKILLS
description: Basic small unit tactics; land navigation; how to read a topographic map and use a magnetic compass; includes practical exercises.

course_name: MILITARY SCIENCE I: INTRODUCTION TO TACTICAL LEADERSHIP
description: Customs and traditions of the U.S. Army; unit organization and missions. Types of careers available to army officers. Practical exercises. Lec/lab.
Prepares military science cadets and university students to excel in the Army Physical Fitness Test (AFPT). (Bacc Core Course)

course_name: MILITARY SCIENCE II: FOUNDATIONS OF LEADERSHIP I
description: An examination of effective leadership. Development of interpersonal skills using practical exercises and case studies.

course_name: MILITARY SCIENCE II: FUNDAMENTALS OF LEADERSHIP II
description: History of the American soldier from 1775 to 1919; weaponry and tactics of the American Army. Use of battle analysis and war gaming included.

course_name: MILITARY SCIENCE II: FUNDAMENTALS OF MILITARY OPERATIONS
description: Basic U.S. Army tactics at the individual, team, and squad levels. Integration of military skills in offensive and defensive operations.
Four weeks of classroom and field training at Fort Knox, Kentucky. Can substitute for the first two years of the ROTC program.

course_name: MILITARY SCIENCE III: LEADERSHIP AND MANAGEMENT OF MILITARY ORGANIZATION
description: Study of military leadership, management, theory and dynamics of the military team. Applies principles to advanced military operations. Includes leadership, management, and organizational theory; group dynamics; functions of staff organizations; development of the commander's estimate; combat orders and plans; troop leading procedures; application of leadership concepts in offensive and defensive operations at the squad, platoon, and company level; and fundamentals of small-unit tactics/patrolling.

course_name: MILITARY SCIENCE III: LEADERSHIP AND MANAGEMENT OF MILITARY ORGANIZATIONS
description: Study of military leadership, management, theory and dynamics of the military team. Applies principles to advanced military operations. Includes leadership, management, and organizational theory; group dynamics; functions of staff organizations; development of the commander's estimate; combat orders and plans; troop leading procedures; application of leadership concepts in offensive and defensive operations at the squad, platoon, and company level; and fundamentals of small-unit tactics/patrolling.

course_name: MILITARY SCIENCE III: LEADERSHIP AND MANAGEMENT OF MILITARY ORGANIZATIONS
description: Study of military leadership, management, theory and dynamics of the military team. Applies principles to advanced military operations. Includes leadership, management, and organizational theory; group dynamics; functions of staff organizations; development of the commander's estimate; combat orders and plans; troop leading procedures; application of leadership concepts in offensive and defensive operations at the squad, platoon, and company level; and fundamentals of small-unit tactics/patrolling.

course_name: MILITARY SCIENCE: LEADER DEVELOPMENT AND ASSESSMENT COURSE
description: Practical and theoretical instruction and training in soldier skills for four weeks. Practical leadership application and experience in a military environment.

Train, mentor and evaluate underclass cadets. Learn duties and responsibilities of Army staff office and apply processes. Execute and assess battalion training events. Understand and employ risk management process and use soldier fitness program to reduce and manage stress.

course_name: MILITARY SCIENCE IV: PREPARATION FOR OFFICERSHIP
description: Recent military history, national defense policy and its application in current world events. Includes military law; law of land warfare; small-unit administration; and ethics and professionalism with emphasis on applied leadership, management techniques, and ethical decision making. Designed to assist the future army officer with the transition from student to junior officer leader.

course_name: MILITARY SCIENCE IV: PREPARATION FOR OFFICERSHIP
description: Recent military history, national defense policy and its application in current world events. Includes military law; law of land warfare; small-unit administration; and ethics and professionalism with emphasis on applied leadership, management techniques, and ethical decision making. Designed to assist the future army officer with the transition from student to junior officer leader.
